message.content: This question requires knowledge about the Earth's tilt and its effect on the seasons. The winter solstice occurs when the Northern Hemisphere is tilted furthest away from the sun, resulting in the shortest day and the longest night of the year. Option (A) Panama is in the Northern Hemisphere, so it experiences the winter solstice on December 21st. Options (B), (C), and (D) are in the Southern Hemisphere, so their winter solstice occurs during a different time of the year.

Options (B), (C), and (D) are all in the southern hemisphere, so they would not experience the winter solstice on December 21st.
